title: Need to import mail from Outlook 2007 located on anothe computer
content:
I have a new Windows 11 PC and have installed Thunderbird (64bit). My current email is via my ISP who have outsourced their email to Gmail - I am using IMAP. This setup is in Outlook 2007 on my old PC. I have setup Thunderbird to obtain all of my current email from the IMAP server at Gmail. This went successfully.

I now wish to move all of my off-line stored emails from this old Outlook installation and also my calendar. When I started the import process on Thunderbird and selected Outlook as a source all I really wanted to do was to find out what Thunderbird would ask for in the way of files containing my data. But, as per other postings that I have found on this site it came up with the "No profile found" .

However Outlook is NOT installed on the Windows 11 computer and nor have I created any pst files or any other files and moved them to the Windows 11 PC. So the 32bit vs 64bit answer does not yet apply to my situation.

So what process should I follow to move my data from the old Outlook 32bit installation on my old Windows 10 PC to the new Thunderbird 64bit setup?

Thanks for any advice

title: Global indexing makes Thunderbird very unresponsive after update to v128
content:
Thunderbird automatically updated to v128 earlier this week after I went to Help - About Thunderbird to check that it had updated to v115.14.

Everything seemed okay immediately after the update, but when I started Thunderbird the next day it was very unresponsive. Checking the Activity Manager showed that Thunderbird was indexing messages, but that this was happening very slowly. I let Thunderbird do its thing that day in the hope that things would settle down.

The next day when I started Thunderbird things were still bad. I tried Rebuilding the Global Database but when I restarted Thunderbird it was just as bad, if not worse.

I then turned off indexing in the Thunderbird settings and Thunderbird is now responsive and back to normal.

Is anyone else seeing anything like this? Any suggestions to fix the problem?

I am a long time Thunderbird user so my profile is very large with a lot of accounts, and has been through a lot of Thunderbird versions, so it is potentially more complicated than normal.

Thunderbird version is currently 128.1.0esr (32-bit).

Thanks
creator: zatz

title: verzenden gmail account werkt niet
content:
Vanmorgen wilde een van mijn mijn mail Gmail accounts niet meer verzenden, bij het venster met de vraag om het wachtwoord in te vullen komt er geen nieuw venster, maar verschijnt hetzelfde venster zie screenshot 1. Aan de SMPT instellingen is niks gewijzigd schreenshot 2. - Via Gmail, Thunderbird ontkoppeld, opnieuw aangemeld via Oauth ontvangen werkt, maar verzenden blijft het zelfde probleem. - Gmail wachtwoord gewijzigd, zelfde als ontkoppelen voor ontvangen wel Oauth opnieuw, verzenden lukt niet. - Daarna wachtwoord van de mail in Thunderbird verwijderd, zelfde effect hij vraagt wel om Nieuw wachtwoord invoeren maar opent geen venster. - ondanks dat het voorheen werkte en ook op andere nog PC werkt Cookies uitzonderingen voor Google toegevoegd aan Thunderbird. - andere smpt server geprobeerd (smtp.gmail.com) werkt ook niet. - firewall en antivirussoftware uitgeschakeld, geen verschil Probleem is dat er geen Oauth venster wordt geopend bij verzenden en alleen bij ophalen

Systeem info Processor 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-1165G7 @ 2.80GHz 2.80 GHz Geïnstalleerd RAM-geheugen 16,0 GB (15,7 GB beschikbaar) Type systeem 64-bits besturingssysteem, x64-processor

Editie Windows 11 Pro Versie 23H2 Installatiedatum ‎8-‎11-‎2022 Build van besturingssysteem 22631.3880

Thunderbird 128.1.0esr (64-bits) Internetverbinding via Ziggo

AANVULLEND Inmiddels ook gekeken naar instellingen server en verzenden geprobeerd op laptop met eerdere versie TB. Zelfde probleem wachtwoord vraag komt wel voor IMAP en inloggen met Oauth werkt, maar bij verzenden komt vraag wachtwoord wel maar knop wijzigen geeft geen venster om in te loggen.

title: Problems with Thunderbird Inbox since a day before V128 Update
content:
On 31 July, a day before the Thunderbird update from V115 to V128, the emails in my inbox no longer had reply or forward options and were addressed as coming from me as well as to me.

A yellow message at the bottom of each email read: "A unique identity matching the From address was not found. The message will be sent using the current From field and settings from identity Marcus Relton <my email address>"

My email provider thinks Thunderbird mistakenly believes these emails to be drafts. I have added on FolderFlags, which now has a V128 version since I first experienced this problem last week.

I am supposed to be able to right-click the inbox, go down the drop-down menu to properties then see another dialogue box but this isn't appearing.

I can only reply to or forward emails by right-clicking in the message in the inbox and I can't click on links in the email. I have to open the link then cut and paste them.

Mail.coop, here in the UK is trying to find a solution, having hoped FolderFlags would work, but if anyone has any suggestions, please share.

I saw someone had a similar problem with their drafts folder in April but the suggested fix didn't solve it.


Thanks,

Marcus
creator: m.j.relton

title: invalid certificate/sent mail not storing on server/not receiving mail from server
content:
This is kind of a long story, I will keep it as short as I can without compromising details. All of the suggestions on the support page have not helped in any resolution. So, yes, I have been reading it for days now.

Originally I was getting the error message "The certificate for mail.*.com is not valid for that server. Someone could be trying to impersonate the server and you should not..." I tried to make everything right on the settings for both smpt and the imap server settings. Nothing fixed it. Eventually I elected to uninstall TB and rename the folder under users/user/appdata/roaming/...etc. Basically start fresh. This is my boss's TB and he has had all sorts of issues since switching from POP3 to imap. It was working fine for a few days, then he got that original message about the possible impersonating server. Anyways, so I started fresh and got it all re-setup and it was working again. Inbound came in and sent went out no problem. Then TB updated to the more recent version 128 and then a new error occurred. First, " Your message was sent but a copy was not placed in your sent folder (Sent) due to network or file access errors. You can retry or save the message locally to Local Folders/Sent." So I chose not to save because it was just a test email. Then I doubled checked everything (nothing looked wrong) and I tried a new test email immediately after and another new error came up. "Sending of the message failed. Unable to communicate securely with peer: requested domain name does not match the server's certificate. The configuration related to must be corrected." I have tried getting and exception but it says that I don't need one. The certificate seems fine, though I only know enough about the certificates to be dangerous.

One more problem is I cannot get all of the old local folders onto TB as they were before. I know where the file is, however, TB will not import it, nor can I just move the folder into the mail/local folders folder in the profile. I was hoping that would fix it, but it indeed did not. This problem I know is unrelated to the connection issues, but it is an issue needing resolved that I have not found a solution for on the TB help site yet.

Thank you in advance to whomever can help in these matters. B
creator: bmbman64

title: Thunderbird not sending e-mails to my outlook.com but receiving email from Outlook IMAP works fine
content:
To try and rectify thunderbird not sending email to my outlook.com I have deleted the acount in thunderbird twice and reset it up each time. The problem is the IMPAP e-mail download works fine but sending e-mail either stays stuck on sending, times out or I get not authenticated on SMTP server. My Thunderbird is up to date with latest version. Any Ideas? Thanks! By the way, Thunderbird works fine with my GMail account for both IMAP and Sending mail - I deleted my gmail account in Thunderbird and re-istalled it - all reinstalled work fine but not so with sending e-mails to my outlook account.

Thanks Much.

title: Slow Download after power outage
content:
Program works fine except it takes over a minute to download email. I think this started a week or so ago after a momentary power outage crashed my computer.

My version says its up to date 32 bit and I'm on the esr update channel.

I deleted a large quantity of expendable emails thinking maybe I needed more space, but that had no effect.

When I start in safe mode (Windows 7) I am able to open Thunderbird. But when I tried to get my mail I get message: "pop.verizon.net connection was refused"

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. (I'm not very savvy about these things)

title: Updating
content:
Dear MZLA,

I donated to MZLA, looking forward to an "improved" Thunderbird. I am very frustrated by the result.

Downloaded and started new Thunderbird, and I have several questions:

This is a serious inquiry; I am desperate for information & help.

1. What happened to my address book? How can I get it back? A hundred or more addresses just disappeared.

2. What happened to all of my saved messages? How can I get them back? I used to have a neatly organized file of saved messages. If I was still using Tbird for my business, I would be looking for a lawyer. As it is, I am simply looking for something as useful as the old Tbird.

3. How can I save a message to a specific category or off line file? I used to have several hundred categorized files in my data base for saved messages.

4. Why does my effort to use a help request not respond to my mouse clicks? It seems to always want more donations.

5. Can I go back to the old version? It was easier to use and more straightforward.

6. What am I missing in this "new and improved" version? Is there another email application that would give me the nice features of the old Thunderbird?

7. Can I revert back to the old Tbird and recover the extensive lost addresses and saved messages?

8. If I decide the "new and improved" Tbird will not provide the features the old one did, how can I get a refund of my contribution?

Your early response will be appreciated.

Jon Wilson,
creator: jonswilson

title: After Gmail outage yesterday I cannot send email via smtp - OAuth2 Issue?
content:
I'm on Thunderbird Nebula 128.1.0esr 64-bit. I use IMAP and I have multiple accounts in my Thunderbird configuration. I have Google Workspace for our business which I can received and read email by IMAP, but I cannot send. I also have a personal Gmail account and that can send and receive.

Yesterday Google experienced a global outage and as best I can tell it has somehow screwed up the OAuth2 Session / Tokens for some Thunderbird clients. Over on Reddit there are other users reporting the issue and it appears to be a bigger issue on Workspace accounts. It does not affect the entire Workspace domain. In our business, I have other users who are on Thunderbird and can still send/receive email on the same Workspace hosted domain that I am having issues with.

I have gone into Settings > Privacy & Security > Saved Passwords and removed the entries for the account that I'm having problems with. That did cause Thunderbird to spawn the browser window to Google to carry through with OAuth2 token approval. That got me back into receiving email, but I still can't send via SMTP.

When trying to send I get the following dialog, but clicking Enter New Password just does nothing and the Dialog just reloads again. I attempted to add a new SMTP Server in Thunderbird, but that never prompts a new OAuth2 dialog for that new server and same Dialog box appears.
creator: spacemanspiff

title: Can't Update emails
